title: Accidental shooting victim remains in critical condition
content:
Owen Hicks was accidentally shot by his friend, Cody Throneberry, around 5:08 p.m. Thursday night, according to Floyd County police Lt. Dan Pendley.
Hicks and Throneberry, 20, of 1249 Bells Ferry Road, were in a bedroom in Throneberry’s home when the 9mm pistol went off, Pendley said in an earlier statement.
No charges were filed against Throneberry as of Friday night.
Emergency responders took Hicks, who lives on Calhoun Road, to FMC following the shooting.
PREVIOUS: Twenty-year-old Owen Hicks remained on life support late Thursday night after police say he was accidentally shot in the head by a friend.
Hicks and Cody Throneberry, 20, of 1249 Bells Ferry Road, were in a bedroom in Throneberry’s home at around 5:08 p.m. when a 9mm pistol went off, Floyd County police Lt. Dan Pendley said.
Hicks, who lives on Calhoun Road, was taken to Floyd Medical Center following the shooting.
While police are fairly certain it was an accident, Pendley said they will continue to investigate.
No charges were filed against Throneberry late Thursday.
“It’s just a tragic situation,” the investigator said.
Pendley said the shooting most likely occurred due to carelessness with a firearm. Essentially the two were playing with the gun when it went off.
